column4: Hello people. I need help getting my ubuntu computer to get wireless internets from a windows computer with encryption.
first I want to get wireless working sans encrypting
and I'm unable.
Someone please help me :(
There's a TON of posts on wireless networking in Ubuntu at the forums...  I use wired, myself, I wish I could help you otherwise :/
I theorize it's just one of those topics that's too involved, and too broadly covered already...
could you link me to some of these things?
could you atleast tell me how to set what dns server my computer uses?
http://www.ubuntuforums.org/search.php?searchid=12959459
I just pinged my server by ip... my problem seems to be setting of the dns server now :3
I'm afraid I can't; not if you're trying to access the internet through another computer
I may have something, hold on, I saved it for when I need to use it =)
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=119787 Dunno if it's what you need, but it's a good starting point, I'm sure
It uses a lot of gui-type user friendly stuff
I feel ya =)
My wireless seems fine right now. its encrypted and such but I don't know how to set the dns server :(
Well, I remember setting my dns servers somewhere, lemme poke around
All I can think of is in etc/network/interfaces
found it :3 its /etc/resolv.conf
Cool, in retrospect I remember setting it up when I was trying to get my DHCP server going, so even if I found that file, I don't think it would help you as a client...
I'm a BIG fan of static networks
I would be too, but I've got a house full of WinXP noobs and the occastional guest
I wish I could have static IPs in my room, at least, so I could securely open the ports I want to enable at the router without having my ip change =(
That's why I needed to serve DHCP from my Ubuntu box, to appease the others
